title: Vincent Girardin 2016 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Fuissé)
description: This lightly vanilla- and spice-flavored wine is deliciously creamy. Flavors of apples and citrus burst out of the glass ripe, full and ready to drink.

title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Bernau Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Consider 2015 an off year for this estate wine. Its thin red berry fruit comes with citrus flavors, high acidity and dry, astringent tannins. Some appealing cherry candy flavors emerge as the wine breathes, but it doesn't seem to have the depth to age. Drink now and over the next two to three years.

title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2014 Jordan Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The immediate and lasting impression is that this is a mighty peppery wine. Tart pomegranate fruit eventually kicks in, until it thins out into an astringent, and yes, peppery finish. It was aged in 35% new oak for 13 months.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 ZC Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Syrah, 30% Petite Sirah and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon offers a very rich nose of licorice, black currant leather, tobacco and potpourri. The palate is a tad sour and dried out, with black plum skins, purple flowers and peppery spice.

title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Hop Kiln Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is spicy and earthy, with brawny, rustic and ripe waves of cherry and vanilla at its core. Simple in structure it's robust in tannin and oak, aspects that persist on the finish.

title: 14 Hands 2015 The Reserve Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Out of the gate, this wine's oak is far out front, with vanilla and baking spice notes that obscure the fruit. The palate shows more of the same, though it settles down a bit with significant time open. It's a style, albeit over the top.

title: Andeluna 2014 Pasionado Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Like many austere, power-packed 2014 Malbecs, this offers an intense attack. Its cool cola and blackberry aromas include a note of fennel. And its berry flavors are fiery and aggressive, with a long, drying, tannic finish.

title: AuburnJames 2009 Bella Vista Vineyard Block 2 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Hugely oaky, this wine also features a dustiness on the nose and palate, alongside woody tannin. Black olive and dried herb give it an herbaceous quality that belies its full-bodied richness and ripe core.

title: Château Vitallis 2016  Mâcon-Fuissé
description: Denis Dutron has made a wine that is bright with acidity as well as warmer tropical-fruit flavors. Soft, easy and fruity, this delicious, crisp wine is ready to drink.

title: Columbia Crest 2014 H3 Les Chevaux Red (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Brooding aromas of dark plum, vanilla and spice lead to easy-drinking blue and black fruit flavors in this blend of 63% Syrah, 33% Merlot and 4% Viognier. It's a bit generic but delivers enjoyment all the same.

title: Corte Moschina 2015  Valpolicella
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry and cake spice float out of the glass. The straightforward, medium-bodied palate offers black cherry, white pepper and hint of cinnamon, with firm tannins. Drink though 2019.

title: David Hill 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This unoaked version of the variety, released quite young, is tightly wound and unyielding. Its jicama, apple and green melon fruit flavors are concentrated, belying the listed alcohol, which is evidenced only by some heat on the finish. Give it ample aeration or decanting.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Kristy Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Light although sweet red-cherry-syrup aromas meet with iron and crushed sage on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The sip is simple yet tangy with tart red fruit, proving very easy to enjoy.

title: Château de la Greffière 2016  Mâcon-Serrières
description: This structured wine has a dense texture as well as red-cherry fruits. It is crisp, still young, with spice as well as some firm tannins. With this bright, fruity and young character, it will take some aging. Drink from late 2018.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This wine is full bodied, very ripe tasting and has a soft expansive mouthfeel. Touches of earth and barnyard join stewed plum flavors for a rustic but enjoyable taste profile.

title: Chesebro 2016 Cedar Lane Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Sour grapefruit pith, wet clay, cut grass and a hint of white flowers show on the slightly reductive nose of this bottling, which opens up with a bit of patience. The acidity gives zip to the sip, where wet concrete and lime skin flavors shine.

title: Clif Family 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Tannic and rustic, this is a straightforward presentation of ripe rich plum and oak, along with sizable seasonings of pepper and leather.

title: Day 2016 Vicis Momtazi Vineyard Red (McMinnville)
description: This unusual blend is two thirds Pinot Noir, the rest split between Pinot Gris and Pinot Blanc. The white varieties seem to dilute the red, without contributing much else, leaving heavy tannins intact. Along with black fruit, there are thick, chewy tannins.

title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2016 La Justice  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: This crisp, fruity wine is lively, with considerable acidity as well as red berry fruits. The tannins are still young, forming a solid core that will soften. Drink from 2021.

title: Domaine Besson 2016  Chablis
description: The 2016 is a crisp vintage in Chablis and this bright, tangy wine reflects it. It has plenty of lemon acidity, orange zest and liveliness that has been partially smoothed out by some wood aging. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)
description: This wine's grapey berry aromas are clean but basic. It has a focused, sinewy mouthfeel and lightly salty plum and berry flavors. Touches of herbs, spice and salt are present on the finish.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Godello (Bierzo)
description: Yeasty white-fruit aromas carry the nose. In the mouth, this basic Godello is fleshy and pulpy. A mix of citrus and nectarine flavors holds steady on a fresh but simple finish.

title: Adalia 2015 Balt  (Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso)
description: This offers aromas of black plum and cooking spice while the firm palate shows blackberry jam, tobacco and black pepper. Closed-grained tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Alkoomi 2016 White Label Riesling (Western Australia)
description: Subtle apple, lime and a sulphuric vegetal note combine in a refreshing wine that is restrained in nature. A slippery texture carries along these quiet notes to a stone-fruit and apple finish. Needs time to emerge from its shell. Drink 2019–2022.

title: Arínzano 2015 Hacienda de Arínzano Chardonnay (Pago de Arínzano)
description: Aromas of creamy oak and corn stalk are oily, rich on the nose. In the mouth, this Chardonnay from Navarra is broad but with ample acidity. Woody, creamy pineapple and orange flavors finish steady and oaky.

title: Bells Up 2015 Summit View Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: From an up-and-coming part of the Walla Walla Valley, this has barrel spice, raspberry and dried cherry aromas followed by somewhat elegant red fruit flavors that taper toward the finish. It doesn't all quite come together.

title: Benedek 2016 Cserszegi Fűszeres (Mátra)
description: Aromas of lemon rind, pineapple and cantaloupe pave the way for flavors of white flowers and melon. This finish is pleasant but overall a bit too perfumed.

title: Bergevin Lane 2014 Calico Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Merlot, 17% Syrah and 5% Petit Verdot. The aromas are fruit-forward, with blackberry jam and other black fruit notes. The palate is more reserved than the aromas suggest, with drying tannins. It has a bit of a hole in the middle, but there's still enjoyment to be had.

title: Carlton Cellars 2016 Auxerrois (Willamette Valley)
description: Young and still showing a yeasty aroma, this crisp white wine mixes green apple and green melon flavors with a touch of jicama. It's ready to go and should be consumed over the next year. There's a light hint of cracker on the finish.

title: Casir Dos Santos 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: This wine's saucy wild berry aromas are accompanied by herb, spice and meat notes. Its choppy, tannic palate is grippy to the extreme, tasting of herbal berry fruits, savory spice and peppercorn. On the finish, a dark foresty note enters the picture.
